name: Transubstantiation Synthesis
description:
18+ only, thanks.

TRANSUBSTANTIATION SYNTHESIS is a work of futurology. What will the world of tomorrow look like? Which trends are currently in place, and what do they mean for us?

Due to the serious nature of the material discussed with here, 18+ only. Minors don't interact. Thank you for your understanding.

(Note: Contains no outright sexual content, but plenty of lewd text and some sound effects. Consent is dubious at times. Bodies and minds are messed with in a variety of ways.)

  • Controls: Mouse, keyboard (occasionally, optionally)
    • Left click on empty space to move there. Camera will scroll automatically if needed.
    • Cursor will turn into a hand shape while over an object, character or hotspot that can be interacted with.
      • Left click to walk over to the entity
      • Right click to examine the object, character or hotspot
      • Double click to interact with / talk to the object, character or hotspot. Specific action depends on context.
    • Text can be advanced or dismissed by left-clicking on it, or by pressing the space bar. It will eventually advance on is own, too.
      • Dialogue boxes can be advanced or dismissed by left-clicking on the appropriate button.
      • You may have to select an option first, for which you should use the mouse. Or TAB/SHIFT-TAB, if you insist.
  • Known bugs and issues:
    • There is a problem in Godot Physics 2D with very fast mouse movement speeds (https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/43743).
    • This will sometimes lead to the cursor not changing over hotspots if the mouse is moved very quickly.
    • You can always move your mouse out of the game window and back in, that should clear up any lingering problems.
    • Interacting with hotspots also still works if this glitch happens, and it can be avoided with slower mouse movements.
  • Graphical assets used:
    • "monogram" font by datagoblin https://datagoblin.itch.io/monogram
    • "Liberation Fonts" font collection https://github.com/liberationfonts/liberation-fonts
    • Sprites and sound effects from various Kenney collections https://kenney.nl/
    • A wide variety of graphics from the OpenMoji repository https://openmoji.org/
    • Robutt icon by OldManGunda over on FurAffinity
  • Soundtrack

    • Vilkas Sound - Office Background Ambience, CC-BY
    • Gianluca Sgalambro - Descarga Con Hiro, CC-BY, from https://freemusicarchive.org/music/Gianluca_Sgalambro/Flowers_and_Rust/Descarga_...
    • Chad Crouch - Sparrow and Chat (Instrumental), CC-BY-NC, from https://freemusicarchive.org/music/Chad_Crouch/field-report-vol-iv-sandy-river-d...
    • Itsensäsyöjät - Springs and black leather, CC-BY, from from https://freemusicarchive.org/music/Itsenssyjt/Elektrique/02-Springs_and_black_le...
    • Broke For Free - Night Owl, CC-BY, from https://freemusicarchive.org/music/Broke_For_Free/Directionless_EP/Broke_For_Fre...
    • Broke For Free - A Beautiful Life, CC-BY, from https://freemusicarchive.org/music/Broke_For_Free/Petal/Broke_For_Free_-_Petal_-...
    • Broke For Free - Solitude, CC-BY, from https://freemusicarchive.org/music/Broke_For_Free/Petal/Broke_For_Free_-_Petal_-...
    • Marihiko Hara - color for me, CC-BY, from https://freemusicarchive.org/music/Sawako/Summer_Tour_Remix_v2_1865/05_color_for...
    • GR∑Y - You and I Be Love, CC-BY-NC, from https://freemusicarchive.org/music/GRY/Retrograde/GRY_-_04_-You_and_I_Be_Love
        
  • Other sound effects
    • https://freesound.org/people/junkfood2121/sounds/204805/
    • https://freesound.org/people/squashy555/sounds/273736/

  • Voice actors
    • Robot voice: http://espeak.sourceforge.net/
    • Person voice: https://parol.martinrue.com/
  • Other notes
    • The dialogue in this game is in Esperanto. Some of it is garbled nonsense, the rest is taken from Zamenhof's translation of Hamlet ("Hamleto, Reĝido de Danujo").
    • If you speak Esperanto, I apologise, because this must be very confusing.
